security: Revealing the existence and location of a CIA safehouse and the methods used to maintain it (ostensible lessee, attorney involvement) could compromise the facility and endanger related operations. Investigating phone calls made by a CIA asset might expose surveillance capabilities and methods. Quoting directly: 'a safehouse procured by the Safehouse Branch, Office of Logistics... Roger MCK. SHEA, Esq,, who has acquired the place for the ostensible purpose of providing quarters for out of town clients'.
summary: A memo requesting a trace on a phone call made by WHD asset Vladimir Rodriguez Lahera from a CIA safehouse in Silver Spring, MD, to a number in New York, to verify the call and identify the subscriber.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret memorandum, dated August 10, 1964, from Desmond FitzGerald, Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division, to the Chief of OSD/OS, requests a trace on a phone call made by WHD asset Vladimir Rodriguez Lahera from a safehouse in Silver Spring, Maryland, on August 7, 1964. The phone call was supposedly made to a cousin, Pablo Rodriguez, in New York City, but the provided address appears to be incorrect. The memo also asks the OSD/OS to identify the subscriber to the New York number and to ascertain if any long-distance calls were made from the safehouse on August 6. Results were requested by August 17, 1964.
title: Vladimir RODRIGUEZ Lahera
